strutR 0.1.0

    • Struthers Wetting-Front Model for Infiltration, Redistribution, and Drainage with ET (θ★ / θwp)

Semi-implicit Picard solver for the simultaneous update of moisture fronts

Source: R/strut.R
dot-solve_q_step_picard.Rd

Solves, within a single sub-step, the coupled update of \(\theta\) at all Struthers-like fronts using a fixed-point (Picard) iteration. At each iteration it recomputes the hydraulic conductivity \(K(\theta)\), partitions the inter-layer flux vector \(\mathbf{q}\), integrates the ODEs for \(\theta\), and clamps the result within \([\theta_r,\theta_s]\).

Convergence is declared when \(\max_i |\theta_i^{(k+1)}-\theta_i^{(k)}| < \mathrm{tol\_theta}\) or when the maximum number of iterations is reached.

Usage

.solve_q_step_picard(
  fronts,
  theta_r,
  theta_s,
  beta,
  Ks,
  f_t,
  dt_sub,
  delta,
  max_iter = 20,
  tol_theta = 1e-08,
  debug = FALSE
)

Arguments

fronts

list of fronts, each as list(theta=..., x=...) with x the depth-like coordinate and theta the volumetric content.

theta_r, theta_s

residual and saturation water contents (-).

beta

Brooks-Corey shape parameter used in \(K(\theta)\).

Ks

saturated hydraulic conductivity m/day.

f_t

top boundary supply (e.g., infiltration rate) m/day.

dt_sub

sub-step duration day.

delta

offset (thickness above the first Struthers layer) m.

max_iter

maximum Picard iterations.

tol_theta

absolute convergence tolerance on \(\theta\).

debug

logical; if TRUE prints per-iteration diagnostics.

Value

A list with

  • new_theta: numeric vector of updated \(\theta\) at fronts;

  • q_vec: numeric vector of layer fluxes used during the solve;

  • converged: logical flag;

  • n_iter: number of iterations performed.

Details

Algorithmic outline

  1. Given the current iterate \(\theta^{(k)}\), compute \(K(\theta^{(k)})\).

  2. Compute the flux partition \(\mathbf{q}\) among layers from the boundary forcing \(f_t\) and local conductivities (top-down allocation).

  3. Advance \(\theta\) over dt_sub:

    • For the top layer, explicit Euler on storage balance.

    • For inner layers, use f_euler which couples \(i\) and \(i-1\) consistently with the chosen discretisation.

  4. Clamp \(\theta\) to \([\theta_r,\theta_s]\) and test convergence.

If the caller detects non-convergence at the controller level, time sub-stepping and retries can be applied externally (see struthers_redistr_under).

See also

struthers_redistr_under

Examples

## Internal solver; see struthers_redistr_under() for end-to-end examples.
